triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: Paper employs a low-gain nonlinear observer to estimate immeasurable states of the multiagent system.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the tracking control problem in multiagent systems with time-varying delay.

triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Paper uses neural networks to approximate nonlinearities in the system and proposes composite NN dynamic surface control.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: Paper proposes adaptive output-feedback tracking control that adjusts to system uncertainties and time-varying parameters.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: Paper addresses control of nonlinear multiagent systems with time-varying input delay using nonlinear control techniques.

triples.name: Consensus (computer science)
triples.relevance: Paper proposes distributed adaptive control strategy to achieve consensus tracking among multiagent systems.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Paper contributes to control theory by proposing event-triggered control mechanisms for distributed multiagent systems.

triples.name: Feedback linearization
triples.relevance: Paper employs nonlinear control techniques related to feedback compensation for time-varying delays and filter errors.

triples.name: Dynamic surface control
triples.relevance: Paper proposes distributed adaptive composite neural network dynamic surface control strategy as a key contribution.
